forum.content:
To me for now, at age 31, life has so far come to maybe one-third of the journey, or even worse, and as the train of life approaches its final end, I seem more lost, more confused about what I am struggling for, and I think there's a fatal flaw in the modern society where the rich get richer and the poor struggle daily just to remain poor.
I start to wonder whether the so-called capitalism has lost its original meaning, compromised dearly by greed.
Good-hearted and hard-working people can never get a good life in the modern capitalism, simply because the modern capitalism makes the present poor stay that way so that the pyramid-like system can sustain, powered by the sacrifice of the people who come from lower layers, and it's nearly impossible to change the color of the collar, and that's why the pursuit of happiness is movie material
forum.title: 睡不著之酸文分享
